Kara Lynn Mularz
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E HOUGHTON AVE,
WEST BRANCH, MI, 48661-1130
Re: License #: CP650201338
Dear Kara Lynn Mularz:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
11/07/2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. There
was one CAP completed for the renewal evaluation 9/12/2023. One area
identified in noncompliance as a part of the renewal evaluation was R.
400.12511(1)(a). The CAP was approved 9/12/2023 by DCWL. No areas were
identified in noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The assessment indicated a
review of the approved CAP was completed for continuing compliance. Key
Performance Indicators were also reviewed as a part of the assessment.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
11/12/24
